comments:
Sometimes when an error happens, like it asks for checking out a file and I
answer no or a validation error happens, the error is shown in the source view,
and I cannot edit the file.  In the 1st case, a "myfile.java is read only" is
shown in the source view.

On the other side, the design view shows correctly the Swing component.

I have to close it and reopen it.
In addition if I close the file, it doesn't appear in the list of most recently
opened files in the main File menu.

David, could you please provide more details as to how to recreate this scenario?
Are you checking out a file from CVS and opening the VE when this occurs? Do you
have a specific java file that causes this problem or is it just random on many
java files?

Gili, how/when does the VE get the "read only" condition in the source viewer?
And do you know anything about the most recently opened files? Isn't this an
Eclipse function for recently "Edited" files?

I use VSSPlugin.

I try to modify the file, then I'm asked if I want to check out.
I answer no.
I'm asked if I want to turn off the read only flag.
I answer no.
Then if I go to the source tab, an error message is shown, and I cannot see my
source code.

This is only a sample of when an error happens, the source view doesn't show the
source code, in order to repair it.

---------------------------

Some other times I try to modify the file and it is checked in, I'm not asked if
I want to check it out.

The modifications I try to do are:
- Delete a control
- Add a new control
- Change a property of a control

Sometimes the following message appears in the source tab:

"Error running validator code".

I'm not sure, but it could correspond to this call stack:

Not sure if there are two issues here.... the error and the stack trace.

Is the error in the code reproducable with with a regular Java Editor?

The stack trace indicates that one of the palette tools was active when the VSS
dialog came up.   Can you reproduce the error by just typing in the source pane?

Yes I've been able to reproduce it.
I'm asked if I want to check out from the source tab, and if I answer no, the
reported problem happens always.

From the Design tab, I'm nearly never asked to checked out.

With a regular Java Editor I've never had this kind of problems.

Let me sum it up, correct me if I am wrong Dave,

  o this problem never occurs with the Java Editor
  o this probem will occur if you open the JVE, and try to type in the 
    Java Src. pane (no Palette tool is active)


Rich... no problems with a vanilla read only file, it seems like the interaction
with the VSS dialog.  We need to verify with the Src. Control tool simulator.

Sorry for the mail spam, I'm not very familiar with Bugzilla.

Seeing this bug also with Eclipse 3.0.1, VE 1.0.2.1RC1 and SourceForge ClearCase
plugin 1.0-cvs (which is working fine in other conditions).

If the Java file is read-only (i.e. not checked out in version control), the
design and source panels open correctly. I can click in the source panel, but I
soon as I click in the design panel, the source panel gets blank and shows
"Exception running validator code.". The exception bellow is reported in the
error log.

If the file is checked out before clicking in the design view, no problem.
